doc.firstappearance: (Mentioned) Captain America Comics #20 (1942); (shown as Ibis) Marvel Feature #6 (1976); (appeared as Thoth) Thor: Blood Oath #6 (2006)
doc.identity: The general populace of Earth was unaware of Thorth's existence
doc.knownrelatives: Nun (Demiurge, father); Neith (Gaea, mother),  Ammon-Ra (Atum, brother), Seshat (wife), Bast (Panther God, nephew), Bes (nephew), Sekhmet (Lion God, nephew), Shu (nephew), Khonshu (Chons, nephew); Hathor, Tefnut (nieces), Mahes (Apedemak, grandnephew), Geb (grandnephew), Nut (grandniece), Osiris, Seth (great-grandnephews); Isis, Nepthys (great-grandnieces); Anubis, Horus (great-great-grand-nephews)
doc.powers: Thoth possessed superhuman strength, stamina, reflexes and agility, and he also had an extended life-span. Thoth was also immune to conventional diseases
